result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quareon Q Banks

Defendant Quareon Q Banks in court.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Quareon Q Banks.  Assistant District Attorney Erin Karshen for Jessica Bellows in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case is adjourned for projected guilty plea in Br 45.  Court notes the defendant has been diligent as to his Justice Point requirements.  mn
Plea hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quareon Q Banks in court.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Quareon Q Banks.  ADA Sam Tufford appeared for Attorney Jessica Bellows in court for State of Wisconsin.  At the request of counsel this matter is adjourned for an additional scheduling conference in Br 45.  mn
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Quareon Q Banks in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has received Discovery.  The defense is requesting an adjourned date for scheduling.  Court grants request and ordered this matter adjourned in Br 45.  mn  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quareon Q Banks in court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Schlei. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quareon Q Banks in court by video with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland who appears in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; on vacation. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with ASL; FSK
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Quareon Q Banks in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Quareon Q Banks in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Quareon Q Banks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
